newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee firms on dollar, stable on pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee firms on dollar, stable on pound.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee firmed against the dollar but was stable versus the pound on Thursday, commercial banks' forex dealers said.
The rupee was fixed at a mean commercial rate of 20.3145 against the dollar on Thursday from 20.3310 on Wednesday, and at 31.4835 to the pound, unchanged from Wednesday's rate.
Forex dealers said the rupee's fixing against the dollar was done in line with international trends.
They added the Mauritius Sugar Syndicate made a tender for the sale of pounds in the forex interbank market on Thursday morning. Results were expected in the central bank's monthly report.
As from the 1996 sugar harvest season, the Mauritius government is allowing the Syndicate to sell 25 percent of the Indian Ocean island's sugar forex earnings directly to banks.
Formerly, the central bank kept all the proceeds and paid the equivalent amount in rupees to the Syndicate.
Sugar exports are the country's largest hard currency earner in terms of net value added.
